name: La Maison D'ete Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 3-4 nights. The first few days went quite well. Marie was welcoming when we arrived, so we thought that our choice was right after reading many good reviews on tripadvisor. Her husband’s service was ok, I never thought he was very helpful or wonderful.
reviews.title: the worst hotel owner I can ever imagine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The problem we had was with their laundary service. We have a Stokke stroller which cost us nearly 1000 pounds. My son made a big mess on the seating cover, so I asked Marie to wash it.
reviews.title: Absolutely superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I also explained to her very clearly " please do not use tumble dryer…. I am not in rush, please do properly". I have washed it many times here, but never had problem. But Marie wanted to be helpful and wanted to return the item very quickly. When I got it back, it was torn a bit. It became shabby. I was somehow scared of her, so I asked her very politely what happened. As soon as I started to point out their mistake, she just shouted at me and never listened, just talked like " we never make any mistake and you are just insulting me." To me, anybody who owned the hotel, even a great hotel can make a mistake. As they were not bad, I did not want to ask her too much conpensation, but I started to be so angry after seeing her reaction. She also added " just tell me how much it costs and I will pay it". I did not have any idea how much it would be, so I could not tell her. When we check-out, they cut the airport pick-up fare which was about 35 pounds( if I remember correctly). Then, we moved to another hotel, as I planned from the beginning. When we were at the other hotel, they called us and asked us to pay the rental car cost which they forgot to charge. We paid straight away.
reviews.title: Great place way off the beaten track

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once we got back our home, we found out that this seating is very expensive, it will be around 300 pounds. Then, we sent her long e-mails twice or three times. They just completely ignored my e-mails. I was really shocked after she insulted me so much.
reviews.title: A slice of paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Another problem of this hotel is location. This part of mauritius was really cloudy and it has lots of sea urchines and stones in their beach. I am somebody who loves swimming in the sea, so totally disappointed by their beach. Our second hotel was on the opposite side of mauritius, their beach was much better and sunnier there. Also a taxi driver we used said " this side of mauritius has not great weather". Also the guests who were staying next to us said that they were disappointed by their beach.
reviews.title: Gem of a place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 12 days in Mauritius, and decided to spend 1 week at La Maison d'été. We were not attracted by the big resorts and wanted something cosier. We were not disappointed. We were in bungalow 1, which has a gorgious view on the ocean. La Maison d'été offers 6 bungalows and 3 chambres d'hôtes, and has 2 swimming pools, 2 small private beaches, a lodge, to have a cocktail, surf the internet or simply chill, and a restaurant, open for breakfast, lunch & dinner, and that does tables d'hôtes for external clients.
reviews.title: Just perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Marie-Michelle & Jean-Claude own the place and have succeeded in creating a piece of paradise where you feel like home. The team is so nice and helpful to assist you in organising a tour, finding you a guide, bringing you to the closest town to do some grocery shopping (restaurant is closed on Sunday & Monday noon) All rooms allow you to cook if you don't want to eat in the restaurant everyday, and are perfectly equipped and so comfortable, including the terrace facing either the ocean or the swimming pool. The food at the restaurant is simply delicious, et we did not have enough of 1 week to taste everything! They also propose you fantastic cocktails, you have to try the Banana Kiss!
reviews.title: A paradise awaits you

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: La Maison d'été is located on the north-east cost (close to Belle-Mare) and this position is ideal to discover the whole northern region. A bit further to what's to discover in the South, but still possible, with a good taxi guide the place proposes you as well (ask for Kishaan, he knows the island by heart and is so passionnated to help you discover the best places). La Maison d'été also offers you (for free) bikes, kayaks, snorkelling material, internet, games.
reviews.title: Heaven on earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you look for something different that the big beach resorts, if you look for a cosy, calm, beauttiful, comfortable place, with a nice and kind team around you to help you spend a perfect stay, don't hesitate and go to La Maison d'été.
reviews.title: The Best Thing about Mauritius was La Maison D'ete

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can we say about staying at La Maison D'ete that hasn't already been said? It is a wonderful place to stay. It is just as it appears on the pictures and just how everyone else describes it. The host are just that like long lost friends who greet you and take time to make sure everything is how you want it to be. But they also leave you alone so we could have that dreamed of romantic holiday we wished for. It’s a tricky combination of running a business but making the place feel like a home from home but Marie-Michèle and Jean-Claude have managed to do it so well.
reviews.title: Superb service in relaxing atmoshere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had 2 weeks at La Maison D'ete and had a really fabulous time. It's a small boutique style B&B in the North East part of the island - so beautifully quiet. There's free snorkeling stuff, mountain bikes, table tennis etc, and a really fab restaurant. The staff are friendly and welcoming and are happy to organise any trips/car hire that you want - we had our wedding anniversary breakfast on the beach :-). Each room also has a small kitchenette for those nights when you just want to suit yourself. This is not a high rise, busy, package hotel with loads of organised activities. On the other hand if you're looking for a quiet, relaxing place, run by people who know what they're doing and really care then this is the place for you.
reviews.title: Lovely, lovely, lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: La Maison D'ete is a great place to stay, if you want to avoid the tourist crowds. They have kayaks, snorkling gear and bikes you can use for free.
reviews.title: Off the beaten track

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very nice as the whole grounds are - some equiped with a small kitchenette. The restaurant which is part of the hotel (also open to non-guests) serves great food, of which you will not get tired of even after a week.
reviews.title: Beautiful place ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ... in Belle Mare. It's far away from the tourist crowd, quiet, cozy and very relaxing. The restaurant serves real good food and even when you're staying there for more than a week you do not get tired of the menu. They have bikes you can use to ride along the cost, they will also organize a rental car for you. The rooms are super clean, the pools are big enough and the sea ist just a few steps from your bungalow.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for our 25th Wedding Anniversary and it was just perfect. A real hideaway. Lovely atmosphere and the owners Jean Claude and Marie Michele were so friendly and welcoming. Nothing was too much trouble and they organised a car and transfers which all went very smoothly. We don't ever go back to the same place twice, but really I can't imagine never going back again. Still dreaming......
reviews.title: You're family!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Maison ‘d Eté for 2 weeks last January. Quite simply, it was one of the best hotel experiences in our life. What made it special? First, the stunningly beautiful location: right at the Indian Ocean overlooking the barrier reef, with the soothing rumble of the waves in the distance. Then: the tasteful cabins (10 in total), in a clever layout that gives you maximum privacy. Third, the excellent food - outstanding French-Creole cuisine - either indoors or outdoors on the terrace. But more resorts boast nearby ocean, nice cabins, and good food. What makes Maison d’Eté truly special is its small scale approach. It announces itself as a family run establishment with charm and intimacy. This is a completely accurate description. Maison d’Eté stands out because of the friendliness and service orientation of its staff. Everyone, from the owners Marie-Michelle and Jean-Claude to the chamber maids was exceptionally pleasant and working hard to make you feel welcome and comfortable. Guests are treated in a genuinely personal manner, almost as friends, which gives the place a warm and intimate feel. The only other experience I have where hotel staff had a similar personal approach to the guests was in the Sukhothai hotel in Bangkok, a very different (bigger, urban) and much more expensive place. I shouldn’t forget to mention the many small free services Maison d’Eté provides which add to your stay: free bikes (we used them a lot), car rentals (the cars are delivered to the hotel), snorkeling equipment, kayaks, and free internet. When we left Marie-Michelle found us another nice hotel for our three remaining days and arranged for a scenic ride with a taxi to bring us there. Perhaps a quote from a German couple we met during our stay sums it all up. They had stayed in several resorts, many times the price that Maison d’Eté charges. I asked them if they had any advice where else to stay. They answered; “Actually not, this is by far the nicest place we’ve been on the island.”
reviews.title: One of the best hotel experiences ever.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I arrived after flying straight through from Washington DC and was greeted as someone badly needing care--and I received it. Mauritius is not a bargin tourist destination, but La Maison ranks at the top in terms of value for money anywhere.
reviews.title: Intimate, warm and stunningly beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Beautiful place to stay apart of the big 5* Hotels. Lovely managed and excellent value for money. Looking forward to come back.....
reviews.title: Beautiful place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can we say that hasn't already been said. If you're looking for a quiet secluded retreat then this is the place. The food is exceptional, the view stunning and the snorkeling is on par with some of the best off shore snorkeling in the world. The property literally has it's own lagoon (we never saw anyone else in it). It's filled with coral reefs and more marine life than we've ever seen. We snorkeled a few times a day and were amazed at finding something new every time (on our last day we came across a giant shell crab). They only have 10 rooms so there is more than ample sun lounges, cabanas etc. They have complementary snorkeling equipment, bikes and helmets, kayaks, internet and a small library. There is a new massage suite with staff on call, two pools, lounge areas and a guest reception. Staff were very sweet and left us to our own devices which was lovely. The only thing that we would suggest would be air conditioning in the room as even though the sea breeze was lovely we did fight with the bugs. Overall it's a brilliant hotel that produces a secluded, relaxed environment. Combine that with the lagoon and it's reef and you seriously can't go wrong.
reviews.title: A truly wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have just returned, 4 days ago, from spending 2 weeks at La Maison D'Ete. The atmosphere is wonderful, very relaxed and all the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. We chose this place after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and we are glad we did.
reviews.title: A very lucky find. Thank you Trip Advisor.

aka: La Maison D'Ete Hotel Mauritius/Poste Lafayette
description: La Maison D’ete is a small family run beach hotel at Poste Lafayette, known for its tranquility and preserved environment, at 15 minutes from Belle-Mare, at 30 minutes from Grand-Bay and the capital city, Port-Louis. It comprises 6 cozy individual bungalows for 2 persons each and 4 individual double rooms in a villa. All rooms are sea facing. 2 swim pools. 2 private beaches, a restaurant, a massage and beauty parlour. Free of charge: pc with Internet and wifi , mountain bikes, kayaks, snorkeling gear...
